body_text.text: Based on a data sample of 106 M ψ ′ events collected with the BESIII detector, the decays ψ ′ → γχc0,2,χc0,2 → γγ are studied to determine the two-photon widths of the χc0,2 states.
The two-photon decay branching fractions are determined to be B(χc0 → γγ) = (2.24 ± 0.19 ± 0.12 ± 0.08)×10 −4 and B(χc2 → γγ) = (3.21±0.18±0.17±0.13)×10 −4 .

From these, the two-photon widths are determined to be Γγγ (χc0) = (2.33±0.20±0.13±0.17) keV, Γγγ (χc2) = (0.63±0.04±0.04±0.04) keV, and R = Γγγ (χc2)/Γγγ (χc0) = 0.271 ± 0.029 ± 0.013 ± 0.027, where the uncertainties are statistical, systematic, and those from the PDG B(ψ ′ → γχc0,2) and Γ(χc0,2) errors, respectively.

The ratio of the two-photon widths for helicity λ = 0 and helicity λ = 2 components in the decay χc2 → γγ is measured for the first time to be f 0/2 = Γ λ=0 γγ (χc2)/Γ λ=2 γγ (χc2) = 0.00 ± 0.02 ± 0.02.

body_text.text: VI.
CONCLUSION
In summary, we present measurements of the twophoton decays of χ c0,2 via the radiative decays ψ ′ → γχ c0,2 .
body_text.section: VI. CONCLUSION

body_text.text: We find B(χ c0 → γγ) = (2.24±0.19±0.15)×10 −4 and B(χ c2 → γγ) = (3.21 ± 0.18 ± 0.22) × 10 −4 , which agree with the results from the CLEO experiment [13].
body_text.section: VI. CONCLUSION

body_text.text: The partial widths Γ γγ (χ c0,c2 ) and the ratio R of the two-photon partial widths between χ c2 and χ c0 are determined from these measurements.
body_text.section: VI. CONCLUSION

body_text.text: The precision of our measurements is improved compared to CLEO's; the final results are listed in Table IV.
body_text.section: VI. CONCLUSION

body_text.section: VI. CONCLUSION

body_text.text: Our experimental result, R = 0.27 ± 0.04, indicates some inadequacy of the first-order radiative corrections that have been used to make theoretical predictions for charmonium decays.
